subject: Philosophy
title: Existentialism and Religion
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Existentialism and Religion.

hook.text: Can you be religious and existentialist? Kierkegaard, Tillich, and Marcel said absolutely.

buildup.text: Christian existentialists see faith not as certainty but as a courageous leap in the face of doubt.

discovery.text: Tillich argued God isn't a being among beings but 'the ground of being' â€” beyond all concepts.

twist.text: Atheist existentialists like Sartre disagreed. Without God, freedom and responsibility are entirely ours.

climax.text: Both camps share a core insight: authentic existence requires confronting uncertainty, not avoiding it.

punchline.text: Faith without doubt isn't faith. It's comfort.

quiz.question: How did Christian existentialists view faith?
options: As a courageous leap made despite doubt
As unnecessary for a good life
